title: my-site
text:
Hi, I am Jiayu Pan. I am a a Master of Health Science (MHS) student in Biochemistry and Molecular Biology at Johns Hopkins University. I love traveling all around. Here are the pictures taken when I was traveling in different countries.

Britain







Italy







Japan

title: Jiayu Pan's Website
text:
About me:
I completed my undergraduate studies in Biochemistry and Pharmacology at China Pharmaceutical University, where I spent the first three years building a strong foundation in life sciences and experimental techniques.
In my final year, I studied at the University of Strathclyde in the United Kingdom, which greatly broadened my academic perspective and research experience.
Through my studies and research, I developed a deep interest in Cancer immunology.

title: Example Analysis
text: This analysis is aimed at discovering how the popularity of Taylor Swift‚Äôs music on Spotify changed over time, across albums, or in relation to audio features such as danceability, energy, and valence. The data analysis is intended for Taylor Swift‚Äôs fans.

title: Example Analysis
text:
Background Context
To provide additional insight into Taylor Swift‚Äôs commercial performance, the following chart summarizes the highest total album sales across her discography:



Taylor Swift‚Äôs Highest-Grossing Albums.
Source: ChartMasters / RIAA Sales Database


The dataset used in this analysis comes from Kaggle. It was published in the notebook ‚ÄúTaylor Swift Spotify Dataset‚Äù by Jarred Priestter. Source link: https://www.kaggle.com/code/jarredpriestter/taylor-swift-spotify-notebook









Variable
Description
Type
Example




track_name
Name of the song
Character
‚ÄúLove Story‚Äù


album_name
Name of the album
Character
‚ÄúFearless‚Äù


release_date
Date the song was released
Date
‚Äú2008-11-11‚Äù


popularity
Spotify popularity score (0‚Äì100)
Numeric
78


danceability
Measure of how suitable a track is for dancing (0‚Äì1)
Numeric
0.65


energy
Energy intensity (0‚Äì1)
Numeric
0.72


valence
Positivity or emotional brightness (0‚Äì1)
Numeric
0.41


acousticness
Degree of acoustic sound (0‚Äì1)
Numeric
0.12









Tipüí° Research Question



This analysis explores how the popularity of Taylor Swift‚Äôs music on Spotify changes over time. I examine differences across albums and investigate whether audio features (e.g., danceability, energy, valence) are related to how well songs are received. üéß‚ú®








Noteüåü Key Findings



My results show that Taylor‚Äôs overall album popularity has increased throughout her career. Albums such as 1989, Folklore, Evermore, and Midnights show particularly high popularity scores. This trend suggests ongoing evolution in musical style, storytelling, and cultural influence. üíó



üéß Fun Fact:
Spotify‚Äôs popularity score reflects recent listening activity, not just total streams.
So a song gains popularity if it is being listened to now, not only historically.

In summary, this analysis shows a clear upward trend in Taylor Swift‚Äôs album-level popularity on Spotify over time. Earlier albums generally have lower popularity scores, while her more recent releases display significantly higher engagement among listeners. The relationships between audio features and popularity suggest that changes in energy, valence, and acousticness may play a role in shaping audience response. These patterns highlight Taylor‚Äôs ability to continually adapt her sound and storytelling to resonate with listeners. Overall, the findings illustrate both artistic evolution and shifting listener preferences across different eras of her music. ‚ú®üé§








Function
Package
Purpose




select()
dplyr
Selects the variables used in the analysis


mutate()
dplyr
Creates or transforms variables (e.g., release_year)


year()
lubridate
Extracts the year from the release date


drop_na()
tidyr
Removes rows with missing values


group_by()
dplyr
Groups data by album and year


summarize()
dplyr
Computes average values for selected audio features


arrange()
dplyr
Sorts results (e.g., by release year)


pivot_longer()
tidyr
Reshapes data for faceting or additional visualizations


ggplot()
ggplot2
Initializes a plot object


geom_line()
ggplot2
Plots lines showing trend over time


geom_point()
ggplot2
Adds points to highlight individual album averages


geom_col()
ggplot2
Creates bar plots for comparing album averages


geom_smooth()
ggplot2
Adds trend lines (optional smoothing)


facet_wrap()
ggplot2
Creates separate panels for visual comparison


labs()
ggplot2
Adds titles, axis labels, and captions


theme_minimal()
ggplot2
Applies a minimal theme to reduce visual clutter


theme_classic()
ggplot2
Removes grid lines and applies a clean axis layout
